course.title: Research Methods
course.catalogDescription: The purpose of this course is to prepare students with the knowledge and skills required for conducting a master-thesis research. Students will learn about important topics such as the empirical research process, conducting a literature survey, and writing research papers in publishable quality. After successfully completing this course, students will be equipped with essential skills to start a master-thesis research and to write a master-thesis proposal.

objectives.objective: Understand the basics of research, including its definition, purpose and expected outcomes
Apprehend the empirical research process and its stages such as identifying research problems, deducing hypotheses, prototyping, designing experiments and publishing results
Conduct literature survey using digital resources
Identify, Read and critically analyze research papers
Maintain an up-to-date repository of literature
Conduct literature survey using digital resources
Evaluate credibility of sources, where research articles are published
Maintain an up-to-date annotated bibliography and a survey paper

outline.topic: Introduction to The Process of Conducting Research
Literature Survey Reading Research Papers Writing an Annotated Bibliography Writing a Survey Paper
Statistics Applied Statistics Descriptive Statistics Inferential Statistics
